thread.section_title: An Roinn Airgeadais, Department of Finance
thread.title: Minister of State Simon Harris welcomes the announcement of new international financial services apprenticeship proposals
thread.title_full: Minister of State Simon Harris welcomes the announcement of new international financial services apprenticeship proposals

author: editorfinance
title: Minister of State Simon Harris welcomes the announcement of new international financial services apprenticeship proposals
text:
Minister of State Simon Harris welcomes the announcement of new international financial services apprenticeship proposals 31.07.15 
The Minister of State for International Banking (including IFSC) Simon Harris T.D. welcomed the announcement today by the Minister for Education and Skills, Jan O'Sullivan T.D. and the Minister for Skills, Research and Innovation, Damian English T.D. of five new apprenticeship proposals in the area of financial services as part of an expanded number of programmes under the Apprenticeship system. 
Speaking after the announcement, Minister Harris said: 
â€œEnsuring the availability of a highly qualified and skilled workforce is a key element of the Government's International Financial Services Strategy, IFS 2020. Today's announcement of new financial services apprenticeships by Ministers O'Sullivan and English is very welcome and will complement the range of initiatives and actions being progressed under IFS 2020 to drive continued job creation, innovation and growth in the sector, further contributing to the Government's strong progress in creating jobs and reducing unemployment." 

Notes for Editors: The IFS2020 Strategy sets out a clear vision for the IFS sector for the next five years, including an ambitious target to create 10,000 net new jobs in the sector by 2020. It is centred around 5 strategic priorities including continuously improving the operating environment and competitiveness of Ireland's IFS sector with education and skills recognised as a key element in this regard. The 5 new apprenticeship proposals announced today: IFS generalist, IFS advanced specialist, IFS Specialist (all proposed by Financial Services Ireland), General Insurance Practitioner (proposed by Zurich) and the Higher Apprenticeship in Accountancy (proposed by Accountant Technician Ireland) will contribute to developing relevant skills and experience to support the growth of the sector and provide a well-balanced educational experience of course work and on the job learning for those who participate.
